intro: Catostigma microcaryum, commonly known as the small-fruit catostigma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with a smooth surface and dark green color. Catostigma microcaryum is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
